resources.string: %s must be \"not optimized\" for best results.
This is a %s device, which may require additional configuration to work correctly.
The application has been placed in the rare or restricted app standby bucket. Alarms may fail to work reliably.

Suntimes uses third-party libraries to perform astronomical calculations.

The data source setting allows choosing between different libraries (or choosing between different algorithms offered by those libraries). The default is time4a-time4j.

This setting affects the speed and accuracy of calculations, and may limit which features are available.

For more information about available choices, or extending the app to support other libraries, see the online help.

Swap layouts to fill available space

[enabled] The widget will switch between layouts depending on available space.

[disabled] The widget maintains its initial layout when resized. Use this with the \"scale text and icons\" option for extra large widgets.
This widget was created with a %1$s initial layout.

Les substitutions suivantes sont reconnues :

Tous les widgets :
* %d pour la date (ex. February 12)
* %dd pour le jour (court) (ex. Mon)
* %dD pour le jour (long) (ex. Monday)
* %dY pour l\'année (ex. 2018)
* %dt pour l\'heure (de la dernière mise à jour)
* %dT pour l\'heure avec les secondes (de la dernière mise à jour)

* %loc pour le libellé (ex. Paris)
* %lat pour la latitude
* %lon pour la longitude
* %lel for elevation (e.g. 185 meters)

* %s pour la source de donnée (ex. sunrisesunsetlib)
* %t pour le fuseau horaire (id) (ex. Europe/Paris)
* %id pour appWidgetID

Widgets du soleil :
* %m pour le mode temporel (court) (ex. Civil)
* %M pour le mode temporel (long) (ex. Crépuscule civil)
* %o for order (e.g. Last/Next, Today)

Widgets de la lune :
* %i pour l\'illumination de la lune (ex. 25%)
* %M pour la phase de la lune (ex. Premier croissant)
* %o for order (e.g. Last/Next, Today)

Widgets des solstices :
* %m pour le mode temporel (court) (ex. Solstice)
* %M pour le mode temporel (long) (ex. Solstice d\'hiver)
* %o for order (e.g. Closest Event, Upcoming Event)

Date Format: A date format pattern.

Available elements may differ between calendars, but usually include..

E : day of week
d : day of month
D : day of year
F : weekday in month
M : month of year
y : year of era
G : era

[Icon Rising] moonrise 		[Icon Noon] lunar noon 
[Icon Setting] moonset 		[Icon Midnight] lunar midnight 

Share [Icon Share] will copy text to the clipboard.

Winter/Spring Cross-Quarter: The midpoint between Winter Solstice and Spring Equinox; February [northern hemisphere], or August [southern hemisphere].

Spring/Summer Cross-Quarter: The midpoint between Spring Equinox and Summer Solstice; May [northern hemisphere], or November [southern hemisphere].

Summer/Autumn Cross-Quarter: The midpoint between Summer Solstice and Autumnal Equinox; August [northern hemisphere], or February [southern hemisphere].

Autumn/Winter Cross-Quarter: The midpoint between Autumnal Equinox and Winter Solstice; November [northern hemisphere], or May [southern hemisphere].

[Icon OK] Choose a custom event.
 [Icon Add] Add, [Icon Edit] edit, or [Icon Delete] delete custom events.
 
Custom events can be displayed by the app, by home screen widgets, or used to schedule alarms and notifications.
 [Icon View] Marked events are displayed by the app.

[Icon Bedtime] Bedtime mode can be used to schedule Do Not Disturb during sleep hours.

[Icon Reminder] Show a reminder notification before bedtime.
[Icon Alarm] Schedule a wake up alarm for the next morning.

[Icon Back] to cancel without making changes.
[Icon Save] to save, and [Icon Done] to save and enable.
[Icon Cancel] to save and disable.
[Icon Delete] to cancel and delete.

[Icon Offset] is shown when the scheduled time is offset before or after the event time.
Day Light Saving: [Icon DST] is shown when the current time applies DST, or has been adjusted by a similar rule.
Heure réelle : Le soleil est à l\'horizon. C\'est l\'heure (approximative) du lever et du coucher du soleil.

Crépuscule civil : Le soleil est à 6 degrés sous l\'horizon. Les étoiles les plus brillantes sont visibles. Il y a assez de lumière pour la plupart des activités de plein air sans lumière d\'appoint.

Crépuscule nautique : Le soleil est à 12 degrés au-dessous de l\'horizon. Le contour des objets et l\'horizon sont de plus en plus indistincts. Il n\'y a pas assez de lumière pour la plupart des activités de plein air sans avoir recours à une lumière d\'appoint.

Crépuscule astronomique : Le soleil est à 18 degrés au-dessous de l\'horizon. Proche de l\'obscurité nocturne.

Today: Rising and setting event times for today\'s date.

Last / Next: The time of the last event, and the next upcoming event.

Spring Equinox: The start of astronomical spring; March [northern hemisphere], or September [southern hemisphere]. The March equinox is also called the northward equinox.

Summer Solstice: The start of astronomical summer; June [northern hemisphere], or December [southern hemisphere]. The June solstice is also called the northern solstice.

Autumn Equinox: The start of astronomical autumn; September [northern hemisphere], or March [southern hemisphere]. The September equinox is also called the southward equinox.

Winter Solstice: The start of astronomical winter; December [northern hemisphere], or June [southern hemisphere]. The December solstice is also called the southern solstice.

Tropical Year: A full cycle of the seasons. The length of the tropical year is measured from one March equinox to the next. It is ~365.24 days on average, with an exact length that varies each year (up to 30 minutes).

Longueur de jour : espace de temps entre le lever et le coucher du soleil.

Lumière utile : espace de temps entre les crépuscules civils du matin et du soir.

Illumination de la lune : Le widget de la lune et la page principale affiche l\'illumination de la lune au zénith lunaire (le milieu entre le lever et le coucher de la lune), tandis que la fenêtre de la lune affiche l\'illumination actuelle de la lune.

Heure dorée : Le soleil est entre 6 degrés en dessous ou au-dessus de l\'horizon. Le matin, l\'heure dorée débute avec l\'aube civil et termine peu de temps après le lever du soleil. Le soir, l\'heure dorée débute peu de temps avant le coucher du soleil et se termine avec le crépuscule civil.
Heure bleue : Le soleil est entre 8 degrés et 4 degrés en dessous de l\'horizon. Le début et la fin de l\'heure bleue se situe entre le crépuscule nautique et civil.
Nom complet de la classe (Activity) à lancer.

Pour ajouter un nouveau widget vous devez vous rendre sur l\'écran d\'accueil.

Pour reconfigurer un widget existant vous pouvez le sélectionner dans cette liste.

[Icon Add] Add a new theme or [Icon Copy] copy from an existing theme.
 
 [Icon Edit] Edit or [Icon Delete] delete themes.
 The [Icon Default] default themes cannot be modified.

Supply events to the Calendar app (moon phases, solstices, and equinoxes).

Calendar integration was removed in v0.10.0.

This feature is now available as a separate app.

%1$s (%2$s, %3$s) 

%4$s 

For best results select an image matching these properties.
